history.content:
I think that schedule is manageable if you have a good group to do problem sets with for CS 170, or comfortable with proofs/algorithms on your own (did well in CS 70). Otherwise, I would perhaps leave out the breadth or sub out CS C100 for that breadth, so you can breathe a little and have time to interview for companies (Fall recruiting is intense) [I recommend this].

I'm a CS Peer Advisor, so feel free to stop by HP Auditorium M/W 2 - 4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

---------

Am currently in 61C (which is more work than 170), 188, and 100, and it's very doable.

---------

^ I disagree on 61C being more work than 170. I spent way more time in 170 than 61C.

---------

^ I think in terms of time spent of 61C it might be more work because there are labs and projects and a lot of time is spent debugging, but CS 170 is harder conceptually in my opinion. I guess it depends on how good you are at coding vs proofs and conceptually understanding an algorithm.

I think that schedule is manageable if you have a good group to do problem sets with for CS 170, or comfortable with proofs/algorithms on your own (did well in CS 70). Otherwise, I would perhaps leave out the breadth or sub out CS C100 for that breadth, so you can breathe a little and have time to interview for companies (Fall recruiting is intense) [I recommend this].

I'm a CS Peer Advisor, so feel free to stop by HP Auditorium M/W 2 - 4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

---------

Am currently in 61C (which is more work than 170), 188, and 100, and it's very doable.

---------

I think that schedule is manageable if you have a good group to do problem sets with for CS 170, or comfortable with proofs/algorithms on your own (did well in CS 70). Otherwise, I would perhaps leave out the breadth or sub out CS C100 for that breadth, so you can breathe a little and have time to interview for companies (Fall recruiting is intense) [I recommend this].

I'm a CS Peer Advisor, so feel free to stop by HP Auditorium M/W 2 - 4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

I think that schedule is manageable if you have a good group to do problem sets with for CS 170, or comfortable with proofs/algorithms on your own (did well in CS 70). Otherwise, I would perhaps leave out the breadth or sub out CS C100 for that breadth, so you can breathe a little and have time to interview for companies (Fall recruiting is intense) [I recommend this].

I'm a CS Peer Advisor, so feel free to stop by HP Auditorium M/W 2 - 4 PM if you want to chat more about this!
Is it doable to take these three classes together for next semester? I also plan to take a breadth alongside these.
history.subject: CS170, CS188, and CS C100
